What did early Canadian pioneers eat?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Sask.)

Name: Max Wm. Clark
Address: Rosemount, Sask.
Birthplace: Brighton, Pa., U.S.A.

1. HOMEWAY QUESTIONS
   What year did you start homesteading in eastern Canada? 1907
   Where did you set up housekeeping? Clamia, Sask.
   Where had you been living before that? Melville, Sask., Minn.
   For how many people did you prepare meals? Two
   How far was it to your nearest store? Six miles
   How often could a visit be made to the store? As often as was necessary
   What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
   What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Waker
   In what quantities did you buy it? One hundred lbs.
   What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.35
   How much did you use Graham flour? 50 lbs.
   Whole wheat flour?
   Was flour milled locally? Yes
   How far away? 10 miles
   What year? 1907
   What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 45¢
   What other grain products did you use? Scratch meal
   Cornmeal? Yes
   Whole wheat? Farina?
   Other?
   Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
   How did you grind it?

butter? We always had eggs? Our own butter & eggs

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Salt Pork

Did you use game? Yes What kinds? Wild ducks

What part did fish play in the family diet? We had fresh fish
shipped in during the winter months
Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Frozen
Kinds? White fish

12. WATER SUPPLY

Where did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (Well, river, slough, dugout) **We used spring water**

How far was this water from your home? **6 miles**

How was it brought to the home? (pail, barrel, tank) **Tank**

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Yes

If you made your own, did you use lye? No

What kinds of laundry soap did the grocer handle? Soap

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? Coal & wood

Where did you get your fuel? From the town 20 miles away

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.
